bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, September 27, [1914]

div1.p: Carter reports on his work; he hopes to finish soon.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, September 27, [1914]
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN COMMAND
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
Sept 27
Dear Laura:
div1.p:
I found Laura's (Jr) letter when I got in
last evening & I wrote at once to Henry so that I might
make no delay in his getting his letter- Unfortunately
the letter has had no chance to go to PeeDee yet-there
being no mail on Sunday. I think Mr Stewart will
go to P. D. this afternoon however, certainly early in the
morning, so it will catch the early train tomorrow
morning As will this

We had a full day yesterday & a pretty fair day
Unless something happens we will finish here Tuesday
I presume that I will spend Wednesday in Raleigh, & reach
home Thursday morning- i.e. Oct 1st. I may not howev-
er be able to do this until Oct 1st in the evening
- late evening. Also it depends on having two
days - Monday & Tuesday - clear. Today is beauti-
ful. If only Friday had been so,-we would
have saved
one day. It might have rained last night & to-
day. Indeed we have lost two full days by rain
since I have been here - 2 3/4 indeed.

I think the trip has been good for me I am strong & en--
during again & won't have to sleep a week to catch up
as I did the last time I came home. Indeed the
work has not been especially hard this time. It
has been cool enough: I was better equipped-espe-
cially in shoes: & we knew how to save ourselves,
& what to do from our previous experience here
I will however be glad to be back very glad. I hope
too that I want to see you every day & while you
have written twice & Laura every day yet that is
not like seeing you. She Laura says that your
rheumatism is better - for which God be thanked.

I presume that Mary will be back before I will. I
When you write tell me what she says of Nan-
nie & her tonsils.

I am afraid that it is a little too cool in Baltimore
It has been absolutely clear here - a few thin clouds
in the S. E. now- Absolutely still but the temperature
at noon was 67°- & we are 180 to 200 miles south of Balt.

Laura tells me that the last Iris have come & been set out
Just before a rain, I think we will have a fine dis-
play next
spring. If we can have
a late fall like last year
I am sure than we will
div1.closer: Your affectionate husband H. R. Carter.
